Class Gui

  • java.lang.Object
    • Gui
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Gui
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    A GUI for the Rover project. Provides primitive feedback on the current state of the robot's journey. Also provides a minimal amount of interactive buttons.

    Students do not have to edit this class.

    Author:
    Wittie, Cronburg, Markstrum

      Creates and sets up a new GUI for the project.

      • Gui

        public Gui()
        Creates and sets up a new GUI for the project. 
         Task DESCRIPTION                  Inventory ITEM
      INGREDIENT                             ITEM
      INGREDIENT                             ITEM
      INGREDIENT
      
  |--------------------------|           UP
  |                          |      LEFT  RIGHT
  |                          |          DOWN 
  |        SCREEN            |  
  |                          |          Return
  |                          |     PickUp PutDown
  |                          |       Quit Help
  |--------------------------|
        To do this: 
         |---JFrame-------------------------------------------------------------------|
 | |---JPanel----BoxLayout--Horizontal--------------------------------------| |
 | | |---JPanel----BoxLayout--Vert-----|  |---JPanel---Box Vert-----------| | |
 | | |   JLabel                        |  |   JLabel                      | | |
 | | | |---JTextArea------|            |  | |---JTextArea------|          | | |
 | | | |   Current Task   |            |  | |   Inventory      |          | | |
 | | | |------------------|            |  | |                  |          | | |
 | |                                   |  | |                  |          | | |
 | | |---JPanel----------------------| |  | |                  |          | | |
 | | | |---GuiPanel----------------| | |  | |                  |          | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | |------------------|          | | |
 | | | |   The room is here        | | |  |                               | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | |---JPanel--Box-Vert--------| | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |--JPanel--Flow--Center-| | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |        JButton        | | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |-----------------------| | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |--JPanel--Flow--Center-| | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |    JButton JButton    | | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |-----------------------| | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | |         JButton           | | | | 
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |--JPanel--Flow--Center-| | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |        JButton        | | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |-----------------------| | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |--JPanel--Flow--Center-| | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |    JButton JButton    | | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |    JButton JButton    | | | | |
 | | | |                           | | |  | | |-----------------------| | | | |
 | | | |---------------------------| | |  | |---------------------------| | | |
 | | |-------------------------------| |  |-------------------------------| | |
 | |------------------------------------------------------------------------| |
 |----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
        The excess JPanels around single buttons are to make spacing. Otherwise buttons on top of each other have no space between them.

        To center the buttons, I told each button to go center itself in its container. button.setAlignmentX(Component.CENTER_ALIGNMENT);

        Possible layouts include Border (things in the NSWE around a big CENTER)
        Box Aligns thing horizontally or vertically
        Card Aligns things with one per page (flippable pages)
        Flow Aligns things until they stop fitting
